Class name: TernaryOpNode. Likely part of an AST (abstract syntax tree) for a ternary operation (condition ? true_expr : false_expr). So summary: Represents a ternary conditional expression node in an AST. Business intent: Used in parsing/evaluating code, to model conditional operator. Keywords: ternary, conditional, AST node, expression, operator, parse tree, evaluation.

Let's craft JSON. Ensure proper JSON format. Provide strings.

Let's produce:

{
 "summary": "A node that models a ternary conditional expression within an abstract syntax tree, encapsulating the condition, true branch, and false branch.",
 "business_intent": "Enables parsing, analysis, and evaluation of ternary (condition ? expr1 : expr2) operators in source code, supporting code transformation or interpretation.",
 "keywords": ["ternary", "conditional", "AST", "expression node", "operator", "parse tree", "evaluation"]
}

Make sure no method names. Good.assistantfinal{

  "business_intent": "Enables parsing, analysis, and evaluation of ternary (condition ? expr1 : expr2) operators in source code, supporting code transformation or interpretation.",
  "keywords": [
    "ternary",
    "conditional",
    "AST",
    "expression node",
    "operator",
    "parse tree",
    "evaluation"
  ]
}
